PerfectNetExp.abs: ...而难以看出它的值。所以人们在数字中，每隔三位数加进一个逗号，也就是千位分隔符，以便更加容易认出数值。, 英语里没有“万”“亿”，只有“百万（million）”“十亿（billion）”，千位分隔符就是这么产生的：, 1,000 one thousand 一千
Of all visitors to China , 13.44 million were foreigners , up 19.7 percent ;, 其中 , 外国人 1344 万人次 , 增长 19.7%;
常用英语单词分类_百度文库 ... 一千 thousand, 一百万 million, 十亿 billion.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, probably from Italian milione, from mille 'thousand' + the augmentative suffix -one

entry.def: A million or one million is the number 1,000,000.

example.ex: Up to five million people a year visit the county...
example.tran: 每年参观这个县的人多达500万。

entry.tran: 数百万的；大量的；数不清的;不计其数的
entry.def: If you talk about millions of people or things, you mean that there is a very large number of them but you do not know or do not want to say exactly how many.

example.ex: The programme was viewed on television in millions of homes.
example.tran: 无数家庭通过电视收看了这个节目。

means.word_mean: 1. the number that is represented as a one followed by 6 zeros
1. (in Roman numerals, M written with a macron over it) denoting a quantity consisting of 1,000,000 items or units
